intro: Thlaspeocarpa, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Thlaspeocarpa is a perennial shrub that typically grows in rocky soils and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in desert ecosystems.
